page.title: 19NEW PLANS FOR HOOK SCHOOL
page.content: Changes have been announced in plans for joining Hook Junior and Infants' Schools into one building.Estimated cost by Hampshire County Architect's Department was Â£700 000 but the lowest tender received was for Â£1.1million.As this was unacceptable the architects and a firm of contractors are looking at ways of pruning Â£400 000 from the conversion cost.The school governors think that,despite the alterations, the money will still provide adequate accomodation. Last term,in addition to rooms in the main block, there were five hutted classrooms which have been constructed in the past few years to house rapidly rising numbers. Further temporary rooms were added during the summer as several classes will need to be relocated during the building work, expected to commence in January 1986.
